mentions.context: WADA shows competitive performance compared to the DNN-based data-driven methods specially in higher SNR conditions [24], case relevant for our data.
The SAS corpus was created for anti-spoofing research with seven voice conversion (VC) and three speech synthesis (SS) methods.
We use seven publicly available corpora: SAS [3], ASVspoof 2017 v2.0 [19], ASVspoof 2019 (LA, PA and PA Real) [20], BTAS 2016 [2], and ReMASC [4].

SNR is computed using waveform amplitude distribution analysis (WADA) method [23], which assumes that the amplitude of the speech can be approximated with Gamma distribution with shape parameter 0.4 and the noise by Gaussian distribution.
There are also other public (and proprietary) data such as BTAS 2016 [2], SAS [3], ReMASC [4], and PhoneSpoof [5].
There are also other public (and proprietary) data such as BTAS 2016 [2], SAS [3], ReMASC [4], and PhoneSpoof [5].
